result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron P Benavides was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Aaron P Benavides is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Aaron P Benavides was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is sentenced to 10 days in the Dane County Jail.  That jail term is stayed for completion of 32 hours of community service.
10/4/22  Defn terminated from CSP and given report date of 11/16/22.
$67 VW surcharge to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  $200 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted.

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 2.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty.

02:07 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Kara M Rolf.  Trisha L Simmons appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.
